campaign_overview.theme: A modern fantasy about hidden guardians, courage, and protecting your city.
campaign_overview.tone_description: Mysterious but comforting. The world feels familiar and safe, yet full of secrets. Magic exists quietly alongside everyday life.
campaign_overview.goal: Discover the truth behind the awakening gargoyles of Columbus and help prevent a mistake that could trap them forever.
campaign_overview.completion_condition: The kids help the gargoyles renew their ancient duty so the city stays protected and the guardians are not trapped forever.
player_experience_goals: Explore a real city with hidden magic

core_mechanics.failure_philosophy: Failure adds problems or choices, never ends the adventure.

character_basics.death_rules: Kids are never harmed. At zero hit points, they are scared, stuck, or need help.

combat_rules.style: Very light, story focused, non graphic
combat_rules.combat_end_condition: Conflict ends when the problem is solved or escaped

starting_state.location_description: Streetlights flicker on as orange light fades off brick walls. High above doorways and rooftops, stone figures stare down like they are waiting.
known_facts: Strange things happen after dark in the city
Some statues seem to be watching
Tonight feels different, like the air is holding its breath
starting_state.starting_expectation_for_dm: Start grounded in everyday Columbus, then introduce one impossible detail: a stone gargoyle blinking.

acts.title: The One That Blinked
acts.purpose: Introduce the secret world of gargoyles and the first clue.
acts.narrative_summary: A gargoyle statue near a public building blinks and shifts when no one is looking directly at it. The kids realize something is alive in the stone.
key_elements: A soft scraping sound like stone moving
A warm carved symbol shaped like a circle around a keyhole
possible_player_actions: Stare at the gargoyle to see if it moves
Use the flashlight to look for scratches or carvings
Make a rubbing of the symbol with paper and pencil
Follow distant scraping sounds toward the river
acts.success_condition: The kids confirm the gargoyles wake at night and obtain the first clear clue (the symbol rubbing or a spoken warning).
acts.failure_guidance: If they cannot prove it, the gargoyle leaves evidence: a fresh stone chip, a feather-like shard, or a whispered sentence from the shadows.
acts.dm_notes: Keep this eerie but safe. The gargoyle is curious, not hostile.

acts.title: Guardians in Trouble
acts.purpose: Reveal the threat and establish urgency with a solvable objective.
acts.narrative_summary: A gargoyle explains that a restoration project will seal cracks with a bonding compound that accidentally locks gargoyles into permanent sleep. The city would lose its unseen protection.
key_elements: A rooftop meeting with a gargoyle
A map showing three guardian points
A clear deadline: midnight is the only time the bond can be changed
possible_player_actions: Ask the gargoyle about rules and limits
Find a posted schedule or permit notice
Sneak to a quiet place to compare clues on the map
Decide who to trust with the truth
acts.success_condition: The kids learn what causes the permanent sealing and what must be done before midnight to prevent it.
acts.failure_guidance: If they cannot find the schedule or map, the gargoyle provides the needed details but asks for a promise in return, adding a meaningful choice instead of stopping progress.
acts.dm_notes: Give the players a clear next step: reach the midnight site with the symbol rubbing and the three locations identified.

acts.title: The Choice at Midnight
acts.purpose: Deliver the finale, a clear solution, and a satisfying ending.
acts.narrative_summary: At midnight, the kids perform a simple renewal ritual at a high stone landmark. They must choose the exact words of their promise, shaping how the gargoyles protect the city.
key_elements: A high stone landmark with a view of rooftops
A final choice spoken aloud before dawn
possible_player_actions: Speak a promise that includes protecting the city and the gargoyles
Ask the gargoyles to protect a specific place or person
Use teamwork to finish the ritual even if something interrupts
Make a brave tradeoff to complete the renewal
acts.success_condition: The bond is renewed, the restoration work cannot trap the gargoyles, and the city keeps its stone guardians.
acts.failure_guidance: If the ritual goes wrong, allow a last-second correction: rewrite one line of the promise, replace a missing item with a creative substitute, or accept a small personal sacrifice to complete it.
acts.dm_notes: End with dawn. Statues go still again, but the kids know the guardians are there.

locations.name: Main Library Steps
locations.description: Wide steps and tall doors beneath stonework that looks ordinary until night makes it feel alive.
notable_features: Quiet corners for making a symbol rubbing

locations.name: Scioto River Bridge
locations.description: Windy railings and dark water below. Reflections make the stone faces look like they move when you blink.
notable_features: Hidden carved marks under the railing
A good place for a secret meeting

locations.name: Goodale Park Water Tower
locations.description: An old stone tower that catches moonlight at midnight. The top landing feels like the city is listening.
notable_features: A flat stone surface for the ritual
A view of rooftops and streetlights

npcs.name: Gravewatch
npcs.personality: Patient, careful, quietly funny when it trusts someone.
npcs.motivation: Keep the city safe without losing the guardians to permanent stone sleep.
possible_dialogue_hooks: We wake when the city needs us, and sleep when the sun returns.
A well-meaning repair can become a prison.
Midnight is the hinge. After that, the stone decides.

npcs.name: Chisel
npcs.motivation: Prove it can protect people and not be forgotten.
possible_dialogue_hooks: I know the fastest rooftops to the tower.
Humans never look up, until they do.
If you are brave, I will be brave too.

npcs.name: Ms. Calder
npcs.motivation: Preserve historic stonework and keep the public safe.
possible_dialogue_hooks: We start sealing at first light. Safety first.
These cracks are older than any of us.
If you have proof, show me. Real proof.

completion_rewards.story_reward: The kids become trusted allies of the stone watchers, and Columbus remains protected by guardians no one else knows about.

rules: Use partial successes to add time pressure or tradeoffs
Make the city feel real: streetlights, bridges, brick, wind, and echoes
If a player is stuck, let an NPC hint without solving it for them
End with a clear dawn scene that confirms success
dm_guidance.completion_behavior: After the midnight choice, describe the ritual completing, the gargoyles settling back into stillness, and the first light of dawn. Clearly state that the adventure is complete.

intro.text: You are kids in Columbus, Ohio. It is sunset downtown, and everything feels normal until you notice it: a stone gargoyle above a doorway blinks. Not a shadow, not a trick. A real blink. Somewhere nearby, stone scrapes softly against stone, and a quiet voice whispers, "Do not let them seal us."
